content: > please note that the paid pdf version consists of two documents the first is an edited ad-free version of the pattern as it appears on the blog *us terminology* > > the second is a written-only version should you prefer to print the pattern without the step-by-step photos sue s dream was created by my friend jenny using my humble sue square as a starting point it consists of 140 small sue squares made with scheepjes stonewashed in moonstone and 18 contrasting colours the individual squares are then joined in sets of four to create bigger squares which are bordered with smokey quartz i call these foursquares because you know… altogether there are 17 moonstone foursquares and 18 contrasting colour foursquares these are then arranged in a chequerboard pattern and joined with our favourite join before being bordered with a mix of the charlotte s dream border 1 and the lynda blanket border 2 it is worth noting that you will use slightly less than half a ball of each contrasting colour making this project perfect for embarking on with a friend 1 https //www ravelry com/patterns/library/charlottes-dream-blanket 2 https //www ravelry com/patterns/library/lynda-blanket
